docs.text: the american action film has been slowly drowning to death in a sea of asian wire-fu copycats .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not a pretty death , and it's leaving the likes of schwartznager , stallone , and van damme wearing cement galoshes at the bottom of a kung fu sea .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sometimes , the mix results in a mind-blowing spectacle unlike any other .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: quality action with amazing and exciting stunt work , as in 1999's the matrix , can be a real gem .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but too often hollywood gets it wrong , even when they pay off chinese directors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: flying ninjas and floating karate masters have been replaced by soaring bronx detectives and slow motion kicking scientists .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in hollywood's rush to emulate the success of the matrix , trademark asian stunt choreography has become more of a joke than an art form .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but iron monkey , the latest asian import , shows us how to get it right .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: iron monkey ( actually a reissue of a 1993 film ) is the story of a 19th chinese vigilante ( rongguang yu ) , fighting with his own unique style of shaolin kung fu for the rights of the oppressed and the bellies of the hungry .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but it is also a piece of the narrative of legendary chinese film hero wong fei-hong , most recently seen in one of the most overlooked , and possibly best films of 2000 , drunken master 2 ( released in the u . s . as the legend of drunken master ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike drunken master 2 , which stars jackie chan as an adult fei-hong , iron monkey finds a much younger fei-hong ( sze-man tsang ) and his father wong kei-ying ( yen chi dan ) thrust into the middle of iron monkey's fight against oppression .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: iron monkey succeeds as no kung fu film since drunken master 2 . at times , fighting styles , especially that of monkey himself , do devolve into the ridiculous twinkle-toed floating of films like crouching tiger , hidden dragon , director yuen wo ping eventually remembers to bring his action scenes back to earth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: iron monkey is at its heart a hardcore , kung fu action film rather than any kind of drama a la crouching tiger .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , there are brief moments of profoundness shared between characters , such as those that pass between our outlaw hero and his good-hearted but misguided enemy , chief fox .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in those moments , and in others , iron monkey manages to transcend its mindless kung fu nature to touch the hearts and minds of its audience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while in no way the equal of a masterpiece like drunken master 2 , iron monkey dances quite nicely to the invading kung fu tune .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: aka siunin wong fei-hung tsi titmalau .
docs.label: positive
